title: Wearables Request — Allow Creator to Publish a Variation of a Similar Item?
body:
> by 0xe58d9940a395d303e691dbe0676710d9c140101a (Archonomous)

Hello DCL Community~

I am a creator of wearables, among other 3D assets, and have recently submitted this two-*Mythic*-item collection for review :

*   https://builder.decentraland.org/item-editor?collection=e678f228-b524-4956-9316-89bdb1b3fe53

Upon submitting, I learned of similar items (halos) that were submitted for review about a week prior by user *@DaddyChang* :

*   https://builder.decentraland.org/item-editor?collection=f2bfdd3a-ecd0-4732-993b-363928622f77

While the symbol of a 'halo' in gaming and elsewhere is quite common, here is why I believe both collections should be able to have their designs approved:

1.  In both collections, the halos are *Mythic,* meaning that there will still be a very low supply of these within Decentraland overall

2.  The scale, glow color, and placement on the Avatar is different for each collection *(click the Forum link below to see a side-by-side comparison)*

3.  The item naming is different enough as to not be confusing on the marketplace *("Halo of Light" & "Archangel's Halo")*

*   https://forum.decentraland.org/t/collection-angels-demons-i-created-by-partypete-is-ready-for-review/1464/10?u=archonomous

The question is, are both items unique enough to be individually approved for the metaverse of Decentraland?

Thank you for your participation.

- Yes, both items are unique.
- No, both items are too conceptually similar.


**[Vote on this proposal on the Decentraland DAO](https://governance.decentraland.org/proposal/?id=917c6e00-e411-11eb-bb4e-e9e2ebbd7fce)**
choices: No, both items are too conceptually similar.
author: 0x5E23D08324f017d5425e59A2782C9ae27aCE0958
